intro: Sphyrarhynchus brevilobus, commonly known as the small-lobed sphyrarhynchus, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its compound leaves with rounded lobes and small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is found in specific regions of South America. It has a taproot system and produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
